history.content:
127 is useful in the sense that a lot of material covered pertains directly to data analytics (a large part of data analytics boils down to solving some sort of optimization problem).

127 + 170 is a fair combo. It will be a lot of work (problem sets are tough), but doable.

There is also some synergy, with LPs in particular. If you have a solid understanding of linear algebra, 127 becomes much more manageable.

If linear algebra is not your thing, then adding a third lighter tech might be too much.

children.subject: What do you think about taking 127 after 189? Is 127 needed for 189, and will 127 be useful even after 189?

Check out my response at the bottom of @8893 and let me know if you have any more followup questions 

In short, if you take 189 with Shewchuk, its still totally valuable to take 127 after 189 because there wasn't much overlap, and concepts in 127 are important on their own. 

127 has not been needed with shewchuck, but I cannot speak for Listgarden/Yu/Hardt

I am in 127 + 189 this semester and its doable (though a lot of problem sets). I have a strong grasp of linear algebra and I might not want to add another course because the psets of 127 are weekly this semester and eat up a lot of time. 

To give some specific examples of matieral, often times in data science you do work with regression. 127 will cover the different algorithms of regression (normal, regularized, weighted) and answer interesting questions such as:

What if $$\min_{x}||Ax-b||$$ has multiple solutions? Which one would be best to choose in an optimization sense?

In what situations would you want to compute the least squares solution $$x^* = (A^TA)^{-1}A^Tb$$ and in what situations would you want to use gradient descent?

history.content: I am a sophomore EECS major with an interest in data analytics wondering if this class would be useful? Also was thinking of taking this alongside cs 170 - how would the workload be? Would a third lighter tech be too much to add on?
history.subject: Is EE 127 useful for someone interested in data science?
